title: Ninja (role)
data:
[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Ninja](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ninja "wikipedia:Ninja")***

- - *This article is about the role that appears in SLASHTHEM. For the monster, see [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja").*
  - *For the role whose rank title for male characters from [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 6 to 9 is "Ninja", see [Samurai#Rank title](/wiki/Samurai#Rank_title "Samurai").*

The **Ninja** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") that appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). The role draws on two earlier Ninja roles - one is a [defunct feature](/wiki/Defunct_features "Defunct features") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* which was eventually replaced by the [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), and the other originated from [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), an ancestor of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). Female Ninja are referred to as **[Kunoichi](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunoichi "wikipedia:Kunoichi")** by the game.

In NetHack, "Ninja" and "Kunoichi" are the male and female rank titles of a Samurai from [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 6 to 9. In SlashTHEM, the equivalent rank title is "Kumigashira" (which translates roughly to "squad leader").

Ninja are always chaotic and can be a doppelg√§nger, human, incantifier, elf, vampire, kobold, or orc.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Skills](#Skills)
- [2 Techniques](#Techniques)
- [3 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [4 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
- [5 Item names](#Item_names)
- [6 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
- [7 Quest](#Quest)
- [8 Gods](#Gods)
- [9 History](#History)
- [10 References](#References)

## Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), which predated the [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") system, so Ninja could use any weapons.

SLASHTHEM gives the Ninja a skill set reminiscent of both the [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") and [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"):

| Ninja skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| ------------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max          | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Basic        | - *Weapons:* [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword"), [morning star](/wiki/Morning_star "Morning star"), [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding")                                                                                                                               |
| Skilled      | * *Weapons:* [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
* *Spells:* [protection](/wiki/Protection_spells "Protection spells"), [body](/wiki/Body_spells "Body spells")                                                                                             |
| Expert       | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")
- *Combat:* [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat") |
| Master       | * *Combat:* [martial arts](/wiki/Martial_arts "Martial arts")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |

The Ninja's [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [enchant weapon](/wiki/Spellbook_of_enchant_weapon "Spellbook of enchant weapon"). Spell success is determined by [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence").

- SLASHTHEM u\_init.c line 2081 in v. 0.8

## Techniques

Ninja gain these [techniques](/wiki/Technique "Technique") in SLASHTHEM:

- XL 1: [Vanish](/wiki/Vanish "Vanish")
- XL 1: [Critical strike](/wiki/Critical_strike "Critical strike")
- XL 10: [Cutthroat](/wiki/Cutthroat "Cutthroat")

SLASHTHEM tech.c 152

## Intrinsics

- XL 1: [Stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")
- XL 3: [Searching](/wiki/Searching "Searching")
- XL 5: [Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")
- XL 10: [Swimming](/wiki/Swimming "Swimming")
- XL 15: [Warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")

SLASHTHEM attrib.c line 71

## Starting equipment

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"rn1(9,6) shuriken"*

- A +0 [wakizashi](/wiki/Wakizashi "Wakizashi") (short sword)
- 9 [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")
- An uncursed [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness")
- A blessed [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility")
- A +9 [osaku](/wiki/Osaku "Osaku") (lock pick)
- a [leather cloak](/wiki/Leather_cloak "Leather cloak")
- a pair of [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots")
- A +0 kaginawa ([grappling hook](/wiki/Grappling_hook "Grappling hook"))

The Ninja starts with a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog").

The SlashTHEM Ninja will know the starting shuriken as "hira-shuriken" (flat shuriken), as part of an expanded list of [Japanese item names](/wiki/Samurai#Japanese_names_for_items "Samurai"). This reflects the fact that the term "[shuriken](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuriken "wikipedia:Shuriken")" was historically also used to refer to other thrown (and sometimes wielded) weapons, not only the star-shaped projectiles associated with the term in Western culture. [Darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart") are known as "bo-shuriken" (stick shuriken).

## Item names

Like the [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), the Ninja has alternate names for items that follow a [Japanese theme](/wiki/Alternate_item_names#Japanese "Alternate item names").

## Rank titles

SLASHTHEM has a different set of rank titles:

- XL 1-2: Kukkyu
- XL 3-5: Hakkyu
- XL 6-9: Nanakyu
- XL 10-13: Rokkyu
- XL 14-17: Gokyu
- XL 18-21: Yonkyu
- XL 22-25: Sankyu
- XL 26-29: Nikyu
- XL 30: Ikkyu

SlashTHEM role.c line 1005

## Quest

| & Jaquio [File:Jaquio.png](/index.php?title=Special:Upload\&wpDestFile=Jaquio.png "File:Jaquio.png") |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

|                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                     |

| & Jaquio [File:Jaquio.png](/index.php?title=Special:Upload\&wpDestFile=Jaquio.png "File:Jaquio.png")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                     |
| **Base [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | 36                                                                                                                                  |
| **[Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | 12                                                                                                                                  |
| **Base [AC](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | -6                                                                                                                                  |
| **[Base MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | 90                                                                                                                                  |
| **[Alignment](/wiki/Alignment#Monster_alignment "Alignment")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | -20 (chaotic)                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                     |
| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | unique (not normally generated)                                                                                                     |
| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | no                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                     |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | 1450                                                                                                                                |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | 400                                                                                                                                 |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | Large                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                     |
| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | fire, poison, stoning, drain, death                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                     |
| Jaquio:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [demon](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* wants your [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").
* waits for you to come.
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                     |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | [monst.c, line 6900](/wiki/Source:Monst.c#line6900 "Source:Monst.c")                                                                |

The [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees the Ninja fighting [Jaquio](/index.php?title=Jaquio\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Jaquio (page does not exist)") for [Fuma-itto no Ken](/index.php?title=Fuma-itto_no_Ken\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Fuma-itto no Ken (page does not exist)"), a chaotic ninja-to ([broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword")) which adds +8 to-hit and +8 to damage, grants [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while carried, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") to create a stack of [hira-shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken"). This weapon was adapted from [an artifact of the same name](/wiki/DNetHack_Artifacts#Fuma-itto_no_Ken "DNetHack Artifacts") from [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"). The maps are cloned from the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest").

- SLASHTHEM 0.9.7 artilist.h, line 663

## Gods

The SlashTHEM pantheon is taken from the tale of *[Jiraiya Goketsu Monogatari](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiraiya "wikipedia:Jiraiya")*:

- Lawful: Jiraiya
- Neutral: Tsunade
- Chaotic: Orochimaru

## History

The Ninja of vanilla *NetHack* was a role that existed from [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d") to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), and was replaced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") by the [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), making it a [defunct feature](/wiki/Defunct_feature "Defunct feature"); this Ninja had a much simpler starting inventory in comparison to the Rogue, consisting of a [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana"), +1 [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor"), and up to 25 [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), a variant of [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10") and precursor of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), included a revived Ninja role alongside the Rogue as one of nine new roles - the discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) After the release of [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3") in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [NetHack-- 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack--_3.1.3 "NetHack-- 3.1.3") by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version, but the Ninja and the other eight new roles were left out. This was due to some changes in the vanilla code, which meant that some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack - most significantly, the NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Ninja role, along with the other eight roles from NetHack-- 3.0.10, appeared in [Slash'EM Extended](/wiki/Slash%27EM_Extended "Slash'EM Extended") and then in SlashTHEM. SlashTHEM adjusted the overall role and their quest, and tailored their starting inventory to be closer to their NetHack-- incarnation by adding a [wakizashi](/wiki/Wakizashi "Wakizashi"), potions of sickness and invisibility, a lock pick, and intrinsic stealth.

## References

1. [‚Üë](#cite_ref-1) [u\_init.c in NetHack 2.3e, line 184](/wiki/Source:NetHack_2.3e/u_init.c#line184 "Source:NetHack 2.3e/u init.c")
2. [‚Üë](#cite_ref-2) [rec.games.hack discussion on NetHack-- roles](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J)

- NetHack-- 3.0.10 attrib.c line 80
- NetHack-- 3.0.10 u\_init.c line 257

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ninja (role)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Ninja
This article is about the role that appears in SLASHTHEM. For the monster, see Ninja.
For the role whose rank title for male characters from experience levels 6 to 9 is "Ninja", see Samurai#Rank title.

The Ninja is a role that appears in SlashTHEM. The role draws on two earlier Ninja roles - one is a defunct feature in NetHack which was eventually replaced by the Rogue, and the other originated from NetHack-- 3.0.10, an ancestor of SLASH'EM. Female Ninja are referred to as Kunoichi by the game.

In NetHack, "Ninja" and "Kunoichi" are the male and female rank titles of a Samurai from experience levels 6 to 9. In SlashTHEM, the equivalent rank title is "Kumigashira" (which translates roughly to "squad leader").

Ninja are always chaotic and can be a doppelg√§nger, human, incantifier, elf, vampire, kobold, or orc.

Contents

  • 1 Skills
  • 2 Techniques
  • 3 Intrinsics
  • 4 Starting equipment
  • 5 Item names
  • 6 Rank titles
  • 7 Quest
  • 8 Gods
  • 9 History
  • 10 References

Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on NetHack 3.0.10, which predated the skill system, so Ninja could use any weapons.

SLASHTHEM gives the Ninja a skill set reminiscent of both the Rogue and Samurai:

Ninja skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: two-handed sword, morning star, hammer, spear
  • Combat: riding
Skilled
  • Weapons: club, mace, polearms, bow, dart
  • Spells: protection, body
Expert
  • Weapons: dagger, knife, short sword, broadsword, long sword, flail, shuriken
  • Combat: two weapon combat
Master
  • Combat: martial arts

The Ninja's special spell is enchant weapon. Spell success is determined by intelligence.

  • SLASHTHEM u_init.c line 2081 in v. 0.8

Techniques

Ninja gain these techniques in SLASHTHEM:

  • XL 1: Vanish
  • XL 1: Critical strike
  • XL 10: Cutthroat

SLASHTHEM tech.c 152

Intrinsics

  • XL 1: Stealth
  • XL 3: Searching
  • XL 5: Speed
  • XL 10: Swimming
  • XL 15: Warning

SLASHTHEM attrib.c line 71

Starting equipment

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"rn1(9,6) shuriken"

  • A +0 wakizashi (short sword)
  • 9 shuriken
  • An uncursed potion of sickness
  • A blessed potion of invisibility
  • A +9 osaku (lock pick)
  • a leather cloak
  • a pair of low boots
  • A +0 kaginawa (grappling hook)

The Ninja starts with a pet little dog.

The SlashTHEM Ninja will know the starting shuriken as "hira-shuriken" (flat shuriken), as part of an expanded list of Japanese item names. This reflects the fact that the term "shuriken" was historically also used to refer to other thrown (and sometimes wielded) weapons, not only the star-shaped projectiles associated with the term in Western culture. Darts are known as "bo-shuriken" (stick shuriken).

Item names

Like the Samurai, the Ninja has alternate names for items that follow a Japanese theme.

Rank titles

SLASHTHEM has a different set of rank titles:

  • XL 1-2: Kukkyu
  • XL 3-5: Hakkyu
  • XL 6-9: Nanakyu
  • XL 10-13: Rokkyu
  • XL 14-17: Gokyu
  • XL 18-21: Yonkyu
  • XL 22-25: Sankyu
  • XL 26-29: Nikyu
  • XL 30: Ikkyu

SlashTHEM role.c line 1005

Quest

& Jaquio File:Jaquio.png
Attacks Weapon 8d4, Gaze 4d6 random breath weapon, mage spell, clerical spell
& Jaquio File:Jaquio.png
Attacks

Weapon 8d4, Gaze 4d6 random breath weapon, mage spell, clerical spell

Base level 36

Speed 12
Base AC -6
Base MR 90
Alignment -20 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) unique (not normally generated)
Genocidable no
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Large
Resistances fire, poison, stoning, drain, death

Jaquio:

  • can fly.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a demon.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • wants your quest artifact.
  • waits for you to come.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference monst.c, line 6900

The quest sees the Ninja fighting Jaquio for Fuma-itto no Ken, a chaotic ninja-to (broadsword) which adds +8 to-hit and +8 to damage, grants drain resistance while carried, and can be invoked to create a stack of hira-shuriken. This weapon was adapted from an artifact of the same name from dNetHack. The maps are cloned from the Samurai quest.

  • SLASHTHEM 0.9.7 artilist.h, line 663

Gods

The SlashTHEM pantheon is taken from the tale of Jiraiya Goketsu Monogatari:

  • Lawful: Jiraiya
  • Neutral: Tsunade
  • Chaotic: Orochimaru

History

The Ninja of vanilla NetHack was a role that existed from NetHack 1.3d to NetHack 2.3e, and was replaced in NetHack 3.0.0 by the Rogue, making it a defunct feature; this Ninja had a much simpler starting inventory in comparison to the Rogue, consisting of a katana, +1 leather armor, and up to 25 shuriken.[1]

NetHack-- 3.0.10, a variant of NetHack 3.0.10 and precursor of SLASH'EM, included a revived Ninja role alongside the Rogue as one of nine new roles - the discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet.[2] After the release of NetHack 3.1.3 in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to NetHack-- 3.1.3 by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version, but the Ninja and the other eight new roles were left out. This was due to some changes in the vanilla code, which meant that some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack - most significantly, the NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the Quest branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Ninja role, along with the other eight roles from NetHack-- 3.0.10, appeared in Slash'EM Extended and then in SlashTHEM. SlashTHEM adjusted the overall role and their quest, and tailored their starting inventory to be closer to their NetHack-- incarnation by adding a wakizashi, potions of sickness and invisibility, a lock pick, and intrinsic stealth.

References

  1. ‚Üë u_init.c in NetHack 2.3e, line 184
  2. ‚Üë rec.games.hack discussion on NetHack-- roles
  • NetHack-- 3.0.10 attrib.c line 80
  • NetHack-- 3.0.10 u_init.c line 257

{{wikipedia|Ninja}}
{{otheruses|the role that appears in SLASHTHEM|the monster|Ninja}}
{{for|the role whose rank title for male characters from [[experience level]]s 6 to 9 is "Ninja"|Samurai#Rank title}}

The '''Ninja''' is a [[role]] that appears in [[SlashTHEM]]. The role draws on two earlier Ninja roles - one is a [[Defunct features|defunct feature]] in ''[[NetHack]]'' which was eventually replaced by the [[Rogue]], and the other originated from [[NetHack-- 3.0.10]], an ancestor of [[SLASH'EM]]. Female Ninja are referred to as '''[[wikipedia:Kunoichi|Kunoichi]]''' by the game.

In NetHack, "Ninja" and "Kunoichi" are the male and female rank titles of a Samurai from [[experience level]]s 6 to 9. In SlashTHEM, the equivalent rank title is "Kumigashira" (which translates roughly to "squad leader").

Ninja are always chaotic and can be a doppelg√§nger, human, incantifier, elf, vampire, kobold, or orc.

==Skills==
NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [[NetHack 3.0.10]], which predated the [[skill]] system, so Ninja could use any weapons.

SLASHTHEM gives the Ninja a skill set reminiscent of both the [[Rogue]] and [[Samurai]]:

{| class="prettytable"
! colspan="2" style="font-size:larger" | Ninja skills
|-

The Ninja's [[special spell]] is [[spellbook of enchant weapon|enchant weapon]].  Spell success is determined by [[intelligence]].

*SLASHTHEM u_init.c line 2081 in v. 0.8

==Techniques==
Ninja gain these [[technique]]s in SLASHTHEM:
* XL 1: [[Vanish]]
* XL 1: [[Critical strike]]
* XL 10: [[Cutthroat]]

SLASHTHEM tech.c 152

==Intrinsics==
* XL 1: [[Stealth]]
* XL 3: [[Searching]]
* XL 5: [[Speed]]
* XL 10: [[Swimming]]
* XL 15: [[Warning]]

SLASHTHEM attrib.c line 71

==Starting equipment==
{{todo|rn1(9,6) shuriken}}
* A +0 [[wakizashi]] (short sword)
* 9 [[shuriken]]
* An uncursed [[potion of sickness]]
* A blessed [[potion of invisibility]]
* A +9 [[osaku]] (lock pick)
* a [[leather cloak]]
* a pair of [[low boots]]
* A +0 kaginawa ([[grappling hook]])

The Ninja starts with a [[pet]] [[little dog]].

The SlashTHEM Ninja will know the starting shuriken as "hira-shuriken" (flat shuriken), as part of an expanded list of [[Samurai#Japanese names for items|Japanese item names]]. This reflects the fact that the term "[[wikipedia:Shuriken|shuriken]]" was historically also used to refer to other thrown (and sometimes wielded) weapons, not only the star-shaped projectiles associated with the term in Western culture. [[Dart]]s are known as "bo-shuriken" (stick shuriken).

==Item names==
Like the [[Samurai]], the Ninja has alternate names for items that follow a [[Alternate item names#Japanese|Japanese theme]].

==Rank titles==
SLASHTHEM has a different set of rank titles:

* XL 1-2: Kukkyu
* XL 3-5: Hakkyu
* XL 6-9: Nanakyu
* XL 10-13: Rokkyu
* XL 14-17: Gokyu
* XL 18-21: Yonkyu
* XL 22-25: Sankyu
* XL 26-29: Nikyu
* XL 30: Ikkyu

SlashTHEM role.c line 1005

The [[quest]] sees the Ninja fighting [[Jaquio]] for [[Fuma-itto no Ken]], a chaotic ninja-to ([[broadsword]]) which adds +8 to-hit and +8 to damage, grants [[drain resistance]] while carried, and can be [[invoke]]d to create a stack of [[shuriken|hira-shuriken]]. This weapon was adapted from [[dNetHack Artifacts#Fuma-itto no Ken|an artifact of the same name]] from [[dNetHack]].
The maps are cloned from the [[Samurai quest]].

* SLASHTHEM 0.9.7 artilist.h, line 663

==Gods==
The SlashTHEM pantheon is taken from the tale of ''[[wikipedia:Jiraiya|Jiraiya Goketsu Monogatari]]'':

* Lawful: Jiraiya
* Neutral: Tsunade
* Chaotic: Orochimaru

==History==
The Ninja of vanilla ''NetHack'' was a role that existed from [[NetHack 1.3d]] to [[NetHack 2.3e]], and was replaced in [[NetHack 3.0.0]] by the [[Rogue]], making it a [[defunct feature]]; this Ninja had a much simpler starting inventory in comparison to the Rogue, consisting of a [[katana]], +1 [[leather armor]], and up to 25 [[shuriken]].{{refsrc|u_init.c|184|nethack=2.3e}}

[[NetHack-- 3.0.10]], a variant of [[NetHack 3.0.10]] and precursor of [[SLASH'EM]], included a revived Ninja role alongside the Rogue as one of nine new roles - the discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet.<ref>[https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J rec.games.hack discussion on NetHack-- roles]</ref> After the release of [[NetHack 3.1.3]] in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [[NetHack-- 3.1.3]] by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version, but the Ninja and the other eight new roles were left out. This was due to some changes in the vanilla code, which meant that some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack - most significantly, the NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the [[Quest]] branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Ninja role, along with the other eight roles from NetHack-- 3.0.10, appeared in [[Slash'EM Extended]] and then in SlashTHEM. SlashTHEM adjusted the overall role and their quest, and tailored their starting inventory to be closer to their NetHack-- incarnation by adding a [[wakizashi]], potions of sickness and invisibility, a lock pick, and intrinsic stealth.
